description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Make sandbox Docker checks predictable on macOS GUI apps (explicit OPENWORK_DOCKER_BIN override; better detection when PATH misses Homebrew).
- Show the real Docker readiness error in the UI instead of a generic callout.
Fixes & polish
- Improve daemon-not-running detection for Colima-style socket errors.
- Document a clear detection/override ladder for Docker-backed sandboxes.
Packaging / ops
- AUR packaging updates for 0.11.72.
